reviewText:
I'm not sure why I watched the whole thing. The plot is a little ridiculous. The cinematography is terrible. The dialog dreadful. It appears that the "Americans" are all wearing Italian uniforms. The Foley artist phoned it in. The best part was when the paratroopers were flying in for D-Day (at around 42:25) they were in a C-119. Unfortunately, the C-119 didn't make its initial flight until November 1947.
Please, don't waste your time.

fictionalized story about some French underground unit prior to D-Day.  Looked like some college students semester project.  Did not to justice to the actual sacrifices and efforts of the French resistance.  Decent effort, though.
classic movie.  This was a good movie for the time it was made.  flow and diaglog could have been better.

For fans of Euro-war movies this is a must have. It's not accurate(the American GI's wear Italian camo) but it is entertaining. Never let facts get in the way of a good story. The DVD itself is good quality even though it's a play only disc with no extra's or scene selection. These movies are hard to find, so, you have to tolerate some loss of picture quality.

Oh what to say! Poorly dubbed, acting that reminds me of a school play, I only managed to stick it out for 30 minutes before throwing it in the bin. If you are looking for a DVD to use in a kids mobile or to round out the set of six funky coasters buy it. If you are planning on looking for a good war flick, find something else.

Obviously a foreign made picture. The dubbing and filming is
typical of these movies. But it's very well written, directed
and acted. The costumes and scenery are not cheaply done. It
has good pace and exciting from beginning to the end. It was
given to me cause they didn't like the video quality but I
grew up watching old late night movies so it looks okay to me.
This is a great nazi war movie that deserves a good quality
release on dvd in letterbox. I don't understand the garbage
they release and this can't get a decent one. I recommend
this to any fan of nazi war movies with a plot not just the
same old blood and guts john wayne story. ***** for movie.
I bought this dvd enjoyed it so much. Set during world war 11 ,Prior to the D-Day Invasion. Film Offers A bit of history And delivers Suspense and action at every turn. Give the dvd a 5 ++++++++++++

The movie was made by an Italian film company in 1968 and distributed under the following names "Brigada suicida" (Spain), "Djavlspatrullen" (Sweden), "Helvetti on irti" (Finland), "Special Forces" (unknown), and "Tete de pont pour huit implacables" (France).  The DVD seems to have been filmed from a camera in a move theater because the quality is so poor. Lots of dark shadows and just not up to the standards of today. And the dialog is very hard to understand. Great that Guy Madison was in it, but even the story is weak. Perhaps the original WWII film released by the government and incorporated into this film may be of some minor interest.

Disappointing. Slow to develop and very short on action.

Plot thin.  Night scenes too dark to be discernible.  Language ridiculous:  French speak French but mostly English. Germans speak German but mostly English.  Shootouts between Americans and Germans:  no American gets killed except for Guy Madison at the end of the film (probably as his reward for being in such a bad movie).  Of the myriad of movies about operation Overlord and the subsequent campaign in Normandy before the breakout, this one might be the worst--tho I could be surprised.

First and foremost, this is not a great movie, heck it's not even all that good! The acting is stilted, the sound quality mostly stays within range of passable and the plot doesn't make a whole lot of sense. Plus, the uniforms for the Americans are not accurate in the slightest. But, this is an Italian low budget film from the tail end of the 60's, so you can't really go into this movie expecting Saving Private Ryan. (Speaking of great war movies, the opening sequence is ripped straight out of the film Battle of the Bulge, like not even pretending its an original idea ripped) What you do have with this is movie, is a not a half bad way to spend 90 minutes of your time, with enough gunfights to keep you at least mildly entertained. To sum it up, you won't hate the fact that you watched Hell in Normandy, but you won't really have the feeling to ever watch it again.
This was not worth watching.
liked it very much.

The production in this film is very rough. The acting was marginal. It is historically very inaccurate--the planes carrying the paratroopers on D-Day never took off for a June 5th landing. The decision to delay was made early enough in the day that plenty of notice was given to the paratroop units that the landing was delayed. The only reason I watched it through is that it is a WWII movie, and I watch 'em all.
It was absolutely a horrable film it was so far from the truth it could make fiction bad. Not good at all
Great movie with great actors depicting the critical first day of the invasion and establishing a beach head for follow on allied units.  A must see.
the voice syn was realy bad and the actors were very poor, poor video work looks likes they used  kid to shoot the movie

The acting was very stilted, the uniforms for both the Germans in the Americans were totally incorrect. Holes in the plot so large you could've driven a panzer tank through them. But if you are into watching something that is so bad you just can't turn away (I.e. TRAIN WRECK) this is the movie for you.
Acting was awful, as well as everything else.  Don't waste your time.  eight more words, awful, ridiculous, terrible, lame, poor.
A good follow up to Band of Brothers.  Watched in preparation for visit to Normandy in June for the 70th anniversary memorial.

While the storyline was interesting and very good action sequences (think WWII spaghetti western), the movie was difficult to watch due to poor Eastmancolor made even worse by the quality of the video transfer.

see it again as picture was poor.

We didn't waste our time watching the whole movie.  Ten minutes was more than enough!  Ugh.  We couldn't tell who was German, American, etc.  the actors didn't even have phony accents to provide a clue.  We were hoping to see a depiction of the Normandy battle.

We are thinking of giving up on Amazon, We do not think your signal is strong enough, nearly very time we try to watch a movie the picture and sound freezes then continues again after a few seconds, it was hopeless to try to watch, this is the third night we have had troubles, so we just switch over to Netflix, no problems there !!
 We wonder what we are paying for, as most of the decent viewing is pay.
  Yours,  Valerie & Roger Button

This movie is a stinker. Do not waste your time on it. I watched it for about 20 minutes or so and that was enough. That is 20 minutes of my life I cannot get back.
A third tier film, but not without interest. Italian companies apparently made several of these and none are outstanding although they can be diverting.

Terrible movie but do you know anything about the film? Perhaps a short review of the background may be helpful. Italian films that have been dubbed in American English are unable to convey the real emotions in the storyline . . . very noticeable in older films.

This was actually released in 1968 and directed by Alfonso Brescia. It isn't an American film and the audio is dubbed. Considering both the storyline and the timeline, it becomes a more interesting film. Films of this genre are usually difficult to find, are in another language or have subtitles. Knowing this information beforehand gives one a better perspective. If you enjoy the vintage WWII movies, it becomes an interesting commentary on European films and producers. The quality of the footage is grainy and slightly blurred and the audio is dated. Recommended for those interested in this genre and for those who are interested in learning. Read the reviews . . . it is simply a matter of preference.
To slow in action and very drawn out to keep your attention. Actors are second rate. Dull, dull, dull. Dull did I say dull?
Obviously a low budget film. Not all that interesting. I would not really recommend this movie to anyone.  Not worth the time.

In my personal rating system a movie that I start and watch for a while and then just give up on gets one star. This movie was so bad that I lost interest about 40 minutes or so into it and just quit watching. Bad story. Bad filming. Bad dialogue. Nothing really plausible. Remind me a little of some of the Spaghetti Westerns but nowhere near as well done. Don't waste your time on this one.
